answers.question: Is your project a member or past grantee of one of these networks?

answers.answer:
1. Activate Local Participation
Objective: Strengthen community networks and collaboratively design regenerative solutions.

Activities:
Monthly ReFi Events: Host regular gatherings to connect local stakeholders, featuring expert speakers from diverse sectors to inspire and educate.

Bi-Annual Hackathons: Organize two major hackathons each year to foster hands-on collaboration, encouraging participants to prototype innovative solutions for local challenges.

Impact: These events will grow the ReFi Cape Town network, spark cross-sector partnerships, and drive practical outcomes in regenerative finance.

2. Incubate Youth Innovation
Objective: Empower young entrepreneurs to tackle local challenges using Web3 technologies.

Activities:
Support for Youth-Led Enterprises: Identify and nurture early-stage social enterprises led by youth, focusing on context-specific issues.

Incubation Program: Provide mentorship, technical guidance, and resources to help transform ideas into actionable projects.

Impact: By equipping young innovators with Web3 tools and support, you‚Äôll enable sustainable solutions tailored to Cape Town‚Äôs unique needs.

3. Develop AI Oracles for Youth Impact Verification
Objective: Create scalable, transparent systems to measure and verify youth-led impact using AI and blockchain.

Activities:
AI Oracle Development: Build use-case-specific AI tools to assess and validate the outcomes of youth initiatives.

Digital MRV (Measurement, Reporting, Verification): Implement advanced dMRV systems to track impact digitally.

On-Chain Integration: Enable these oracles to trigger blockchain actions like token transactions, impact certificate issuance, and smart contract execution.

Service Offering: Provide these tools to mission-aligned organizations, generating revenue to sustain ReFi Cape Town DAO‚Äôs operations.

Impact: This innovation will automate and scale impact evaluation, offering transparency and trust while creating a funding stream for your broader mission.

4. Foster Knowledge Exchange
Objective: Connect ecosystems and share expertise to build resilient, collaborative futures.

Activities:
Technical Workshops: Offer training sessions on Web3 and regenerative finance for youth and developers.

University Outreach: Partner with academic institutions to engage students and faculty in ReFi initiatives.

Community Partnerships: Link NGOs, Web3 developers, and regenerative finance leaders for co-creation and knowledge sharing.

Impact: These efforts will bridge gaps between stakeholders, equipping young people and organizations with the skills and networks to thrive.

 Building Transparent Governance
Objective: Establish a decentralized, community-driven governance framework.

Activities:
Constitutional Development: Draft and formalize governance documents to define roles, processes, and principles.

Decentralized Decision-Making: Enable community-led groups to propose and vote on treasury allocations using transparent mechanisms.

Impact: This will ensure resources are managed inclusively and accountably, empowering the community to shape ReFi Cape Town‚Äôs future.
answers.question: What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?

project.title: ReFi Cape Town
project.description:
# üå± ReFi Cape Town: Empowering Youth for a Regenerative Future #
ReFi Cape Town is a youth-led initiative using Web3 and regenerative design to address deep-rooted social and environmental challenges in Cape Town. With one of the highest inequality rates globally (Gini coefficient: 0.67) and a youth unemployment rate of 44.3% ([Stats SA, 2023](https://www.statssa.gov.za/publications/P0211/P02113rdQuarter2023.pdf); [World Bank, 2023](https://www.worldbank.org/en/country/southafrica/publication/south-africa-economic-update)), many young people face limited access to basic services such as water, energy, housing, and education. 
We create opportunities for youth to lead systems change through innovation, digital infrastructure, and community action.

[![Hackethon one](https://i.imgur.com/SqRiVjh.jpeg "Optional hover text")](https://i.imgur.com/SqRiVjh.jpeg)


## üéØ Mission Statement ##
ReFi Cape Town is a community-driven initiative for regenerative urban development through Web3, human-centered design, and biomimicry.
Our mission is to equip young South Africans, NGOs, and grassroots social enterprises with tools and networks to tackle systemic challenges like inequality, unemployment, and limited service access.
We are building digital infrastructure that enables youth-led initiatives to coordinate, measure, verify, finance, and govern impactful solutions for people and the planet.


## üß≠ Our Core Objectives ##

[![Hackethon one](https://i.imgur.com/sZmQ77l.jpeg "Optional hover text")](https://i.imgur.com/sZmQ77l.jpeg)


**1. Activate Local Participation**
We host monthly ReFi events and bi-annual hackathons to grow networks and co-design regenerative solutions. These gatherings feature expert speakers and hands-on collaboration across sectors.
**2. Incubate Youth Innovation**
We support early-stage, youth-led social enterprises working on context-specific challenges that leverage Web3 tools. Our incubation program offers mentorship and practical support to move ideas from concept to implementation.
**3. Develop AI Oracles for Youth Impact Verification**
We want to build out use-case driven AI Oracles that can evaluate and verify youth-led impact activities. These oracles enable advanced digital measurement, reporting, and verification (dMRV) and can trigger on-chain actions such as token transactions, issuance of impact certificates, and smart contract execution. By offering these services to mission-aligned organizations, we support scalable, automated, and transparent impact evaluation across youth-focused programs. This can generate revenue for supporting the mandate of the ReFi Cape Town DAO. 
**4. Foster Knowledge Exchange**
Through technical workshops, university outreach, and community partnerships, we bridge ecosystems‚Äîlinking young people, NGOs, Web3 developers, and regenerative finance leaders to co-create resilient futures.
**üîê Building Transparent Governance**
We are developing constitutional documents to formalize our governance structures, laying the foundation for decentralized decision-making. Our goal is to empower community-led groups to propose and vote on how the ReFi Cape Town treasury is used‚Äîensuring transparent, inclusive, and accountable stewardship of resource

[![Hackethon one](https://i.imgur.com/X8AzSut.jpeg "Optional hover text")](https://i.imgur.com/X8AzSut.jpeg)


## üë• Team ##
ReFi Cape Town is led by a diverse and multidisciplinary team rooted in both local action and global innovation:
[Shawn Alimohammadi](https://www.linkedin.com/in/shawn-alimohammadi-4b34b3139/)
**Systems Builder & Regeneration Strategist**
Youth & Green Economy Lead at IXO World and social entrepreneur. Shawn leads the development of dMRV infrastructure and tokenized finance models for impact, with a focus on enabling community-driven solutions across Africa.


[Phumlani Dlamini](https://www.linkedin.com/in/phumlani-bright-dlamini-8b0137b9/)
 **Community Organizer & Innovation Catalyst**
A dynamic youth leader, Phumlani bridges grassroots movements and technology adoption. He drives local engagement through immersive event experiences and strategic partnerships within Cape Town‚Äôs creative and development sectors.


[Ayakha Mzimkulu](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ayakha-mzimkulu/)
 **Technologist & Youth Advocate**
With experience in civic technology and digital inclusion, Ayakha leads youth outreach and learning programs. He ensures accessibility of Web3 tools and fosters early adoption among students and aspiring innovators.



## üí∏Funding Plan & Resource Allocation ##
This section outlines the estimated costs associated with our project, ensuring transparency and accountability in the allocation of funds.

1.  Website hosting and infrastructure: $168
2.  Venue hire for events & hackathon: $2,000
3.  Hackathon prize pool: $2,000
4.  Equipment and logistics: $1,500
5.  Community outreach and transport: $1,200
6.  Digital advertising and promotions: $800
7.  Project management & coordination: 10%
8.  Workshop materials and refreshments: $600

## üìà Track Record ##
We have successfully hosted multiple public ReFi events with curated speakers, such as [Kristina Zittel](https://www.linkedin.com/in/kristina-zittel-29764a184/)(**Unicef**), [Alwyn Van Wyk](https://www.linkedin.com/in/alwynvanwykyounglingsafrica/)(**ixo**) and [Mattias Ohlson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mattiasohlson/)(**Emerging Cooking Solutions**), [Andrew Murray](https://www.linkedin.com/in/andrewcmmurray/)(**Switch Energy**) drawing over 50 participants each. Our most recent hackathon brought together more than 60 youth, developers, and impact leaders, producing early-stage ReFi solutions with real implementation potential. These achievements highlight our ability to mobilize Cape Town‚Äôs innovation ecosystem toward regenerative outcomes.
These are the links to some of our events and hackathon; 
https://www.reficapetown.com/post/our-goal-is-to-make-water-available-for-everyone
https://www.reficapetown.com/post/hacking-the-tokenised-impacts-economy

## Join the Movement ##

[![Hackethon one](https://i.imgur.com/AehMTaT.jpeg "Optional hover text")](https://i.imgur.com/AehMTaT.jpeg)

Support ReFi Cape Town in shaping a regenerative urban future, powered by decentralized infrastructure, youth innovation, and grassroots solutions. Your contributions will help us build resilient ecosystems from the ground up‚Äîstarting right here in Cape Town where solutions are urgently needed.
üîó Learn more: https://www.reficapetown.com/
 ü§ù Partner with us or donate today to accelerate local impact through global tools.
